items.title: Mexico U.S. Natural Gas Imports Climb as Waha Prices Stay Negative
items.summary: Mexico’s imports of U.S. gas are gaining strength at the end of winter as U.S. natural gas prices soften.

items.title: MidDay Futures: Natural Gas Prices Break Out of Purgatory
items.summary: Natural gas futures hovered in limbo early Friday — and much of the week — before bounding higher at midday as traders weighed near-term demand strength against forecasts for milder late February weather and elevated production. Prices fluttered in a

items.title: DT Midstream Raises Natural Gas Pipeline Backlog 50% on ‘Generational’ Midwest Demand Wave
items.summary: Surging Upper Midwest natural gas demand has led DT Midstream Inc. (DTM) to boost its five-year organic project backlog by 50% to $3.4 billion and sanction two expansion projects, with more capacity in the works aimed at easing supply constraints aro

items.title: Midmorning Markets: Robust LNG, Scattered Cold Keeping Natural Gas Market Afloat
items.summary: With outsized weekly storage withdrawals in the rearview mirror for now, the natural gas market was looking for bullish catalysts heading into the weekend.

items.title: Futures Settle: Forecast Swings Trigger Hectic Natural Gas Trading Ahead of Weekend
items.summary: March Nymex natural gas futures jumped late Friday after trading in a tight range, as colder U.S. weather model revisions sparked buying. The contract still finished the week down 19.6 cents from last Friday but settled back above the key $3.00/MMBtu

items.title: MidDay Snapshot: Winter Revival Fails to Boost Overall Natural Gas Cash Prices
items.summary: Natural gas spot prices advanced in the East and Midwest as of early afternoon on Friday, supported by a fresh bout of cold. But price retreats in the West and portions of Texas weighed on the national average.

items.title: Vessel Traffic Limited at Sabine Pass LNG by Heavy Fog Forecast Through Weekend
items.summary: Heavy fog continued to stop vessel traffic on the Sabine-Neches waterway Friday and again limited LNG exports.

items.title: Permian Plunge Pressures Natural Gas Forward Curve as Northeast Premiums Fade
items.summary: A sharp breakdown in West Texas pricing and a moderating Northeast is testing the forward curve, exposing a widening divide between supply-heavy basins and more balanced markets in the west.

items.title: Spot Prices Wrap: Cash Gas Slides as Western Selloff Offsets Cold-Driven Gains
items.summary: Cold forecasts for the weekend lifted natural gas prices for Saturday–Monday delivery across major consuming regions, but warming in the West and Texas triggered steep losses that pulled the national average lower.

items.title: US Oil Drilling Activity Still Going Nowhere
items.summary: The total number of active drilling rigs for oil and gas in the United States stayed the same this week, according to new data that Baker Hughes published on Friday, keeping the total rig count in the US  at 551 this week, down 41 from this same time

items.title: Wood Mackenzie Says Big Oil’s Strategy Has Snapped Back to Upstream
items.summary: If there was any lingering doubt about what’s keeping Big Oil executives up at night, the fourth-quarter results cleared it up. It’s not slogans. It’s not transition optics. It’s whether they have enough high-quality barrels to avoid production decli

items.title: FT Uncovers $90 Billion Russian Oil Smuggling Operation
items.summary: Nearly fifty seemingly separate companies have been involved in coordinating to mask the origin of Russian oil, moving crude worth at least $90 billion, an investigation of the Financial Times has found.  FT uncovered the network due to an IT blunder

items.title: U.S.-Iran Tensions Threaten to Send Oil Tanker Rates Soaring
items.summary: The ratcheting up of tensions between the United States and Iran could push an already red-hot supertanker market even higher with rates soaring to the highest level since 2019, analysts say.  The daily rate for hiring a supertanker on the key Middle

items.title: Oil Bulls Regain Control as Middle East Risks Escalate
items.summary: Light crude oil futures are extending their gains this week, up 5.70% and threatening to break out to the upside as U.S.-Iran tensions continue to escalate. The market has rallied more than 20% from its December lows, and the big question now is how

items.title: China Hikes Russian Crude Imports as India Retreats
